scenarioDescription:
The HD 141399 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 141399 is a star with 1.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.46 times its radius. It is located 120.73 light years away from the solar system.

HD 141399 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 141399 system


HD 141399 b

HD 141399 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.41 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 141399 b is 143.418 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 141399 b is 14.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 141399 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 141399 c

HD 141399 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.69 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 141399 c is 422.940 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 141399 c is 13.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 141399 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 141399 d

HD 141399 d was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 141399 d is 375.240 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 141399 d is 13.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 141399 d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 141399 e

HD 141399 e was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 5.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 141399 e is 209.880 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 141399 e is 14.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 141399 e is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 141399, which contains 4 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: HD 141399 - System With 4 Exoplanets
